definitions.definition: To take advantage of the kindness of others.
examples: He has been sponging off his friends for a month now.

definitions.definition: To get by imposition ; to scrounge .
definitions.label_groups: transitive , intransitive with on or upon

definitions.definition: To deprive (somebody) of something by imposition.
To clean , soak up, or dab with a sponge.
To suck in, or imbibe , like a sponge.
To wipe out with a sponge, as letters or writing; to efface; to destroy all trace of.
To be converted , as dough , into a light, spongy mass by the agency of yeast or leaven .
To use a piece of wild sponge as a tool when foraging for food .

main_definition: ( intransitive , slang ) To take advantage of the kindness of others.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , intransitive with on or upon ) To get by imposition ; to scrounge .
( transitive ) To deprive (somebody) of something by imposition.
To clean , soak up, or dab with a sponge.
To suck in, or imbibe , like a sponge.
To wipe out with a sponge, as letters or writing; to efface; to destroy all trace of.
( intransitive , baking ) To be converted , as dough , into a light, spongy mass by the agency of yeast or leaven .
( marine biology , of dolphins ) To use a piece of wild sponge as a tool when foraging for food .
